sentences.english: There"re so many demands on my time that I have very little leisure."
sentences.chinese: 有许多事要花时间去做，简直没有空暇。

sentences.english: His spare style defined American modernism, and his life made machismo a cliché.
sentences.chinese: 空暇界定美国现代风格，他的一生作了主义陈词滥调。

sentences.english: Please do it at your leisure.
sentences.chinese: 请你在空暇时间做一下。

sentences.english: Playing piano is another hobby during my spare time.
sentences.chinese: 弹钢琴是我空暇时间的另一大爱好。

sentences.english: If your busy schedule a bit spare, can receive my call?
sentences.chinese: 如您在百忙之中有点空暇，能否接受我的拜访？

sentences.english: Arthur was reading hard and had little spare time.
sentences.chinese: 亚瑟努力阅读，几乎没有空暇。

sentences.english: Please peruse this report at your leisure.
sentences.chinese: 请在空暇时细读这篇报道。

sentences.english: Don't have the time to travel and relax?
sentences.chinese: 没空暇时间旅游松弛身心？

sentences.english: None but a wise man can employ leisure well.
sentences.chinese: 只有明智的人才能合理使用空暇时间。

sentences.english: She spends much of her leisure time watchellong TV.
sentences.chinese: 她花了几多空暇时间看电视机。

sentences.english: Look at the pockets of available time between activities or appointments.
sentences.chinese: 看一下那些在你活动和约会之间的空暇的时间。

sentences.english: In my spare time, I watch TV series and learn folk dance .
sentences.chinese: 在空暇时，我会看电视剧以及学习民族舞。

definition: to take some time out/to make use of a spare moment
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
to find the time to do sth
to (try to) find the time to
